StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_MIDeleteCandidateStatus]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@NWAID int, @CandidateStatusID int, @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @DBID int DECLARE @DBNAME sysname DECLARE @ErrMsg varchar(100)
SELECT @DBID = DB_ID(), @DBNAME = DB_NAME()
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CANDIDATE_STATUS WHERE CANDIDATE_STATUS_ID = @CandidateStatusID) BEGIN --- BEGIN TRASACTION
--- UPDATE THE USER LOGIN AND UPDATE_DATE BEFORE DELETING CANDIDATE STATUS DATA --- SO THAT THE RIGHT INFORMATION IS REFLECTED IN THE TLOG UPDATE CANDIDATE_STATUS SET USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE CANDIDATE_STATUS_ID = @CandidateStatusID
--- DELETE RECORD FROM CANDIDATE_STATUS DELETE FROM CANDIDATE_STATUS WHERE CANDIDATE_STATUS_ID = @CandidateStatusID
IF @@ERROR != 0 OR @@ROWCOUNT = 0 BEGIN --- ROLLBACK TRANSACTION SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred dele.ng the status record for NWA ' + CONVERT(VARCHAR, @NWAID) + '.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 1, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END
--- IF WE MAKE IT HERE COMMIT THE TRANSACTION --- COMMIT TRANSACTION END
--- CLEAN UP SET NOCOUNT OFF
